Lot 5 is a township in Prince County, Prince Edward Island, Canada created during the 1764â€“1766 survey of Samuel Holland.  It is part of Egmont Parish.
Communities
Incorporated municipalities:
* Alberton
* Northport
Civic address communities:
* Alberton
* Bloomfield
* Bloomfield Corner
* Brooklyn
* Cascumpec
* Duvar
* Forestview
* Fortune Cove
* Glengarry
* Howlan
* Kelly Road
* Mill River East
* Northport
* Piusville
* Rosebank
* St. Anthony
* Union
* Woodstock
History
Lot 5 was awarded to Edward Lewis in the 1767 land lottery while Lewis was the Member of Parliament (MP) for Radnor. The township became jointly owned with John Hill in 1779 and subsequently went through various owners under feudalism when Prince Edward Island was a British colony prior to Canadian Confederation.
